items.title: Boost to metals & mining sector in FY27 budget signals self-reliant India: Experts
items.summary: The Union Budget for FY27 prioritizes strengthening India's industrial and manufacturing sectors, with a significant focus on metals, mining, and MSMEs. Key proposals include dedicated corridors in mineral-rich states and import duty exemptions for critical mineral processing, aiming to boost domestic production and exports. These measures are expected to create millions of jobs and enhance economic independence.

items.summary: The government is launching 'Bharat-VISTAAR', a multilingual AI tool to integrate agricultural portals and ICAR practices. This initiative aims to provide farmers with customized advisory support, enhancing farm productivity, enabling better decision-making, and reducing risks. Experts believe it will accelerate precision farming adoption and empower farmers with timely, data-driven guidance.

items.summary: “The Budget is totally disappointing. It has ignored the State’s interests, and there are no schemes for the welfare of the poor, women, farmers, and those on the margins of society,” he said in a statement

items.summary: Market veteran Sunil Singhania noted that while the Union Budget initially disappointed, increased allocations to railways, defense, and infrastructure offer long-term growth potential. However, recurring tax changes, particularly to STT and capital gains, create investor uncertainty. Singhania emphasized the need for policy stability to attract foreign investment and support India's ambitious economic expansion goals.

items.summary: Though the immediate market reaction may reflect dashed expectations hitting short-term sentiment, the Budget’s capex focus and support for key sectors should drive medium-term growth and boost long-term investment

items.summary: Capital expenditure is projected to grow by 20% compared to the revised estimates of 2025-2026, signalling a renewed push for hardware and mission development in the coming year

items.title: Railways: FM Sitharaman allocates Rs 2.77 lakh crore for capital expenditure
items.summary: Indian Railways receives a record capital expenditure allocation of Rs 2,77,830 crore for financial year 2026-27. This significant funding will drive new line construction, locomotive and coach purchases, and gauge conversion. The allocation represents a 10.25 percent increase from the previous year. Railways also anticipates a surplus of over Rs 3,500 crore.

items.summary: West Bengal real estate developers welcomed the Union Budget's infrastructure focus, anticipating improved connectivity and growth in Tier-2 and Tier-3 cities. However, they expressed disappointment over the absence of affordable housing measures, warning of a potential supply shrink due to rising costs. Developers highlighted the need for revised price caps and relief on GST and income tax benefits.

items.summary: The Union Budget’s hike in Securities Transaction Tax (STT) on futures and options has drawn attention to the risks faced by retail investors in the derivatives market. According to the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI), over nine out of ten individual traders in the F&O segment incur losses.

items.summary: Over 45 stocks, including ITC, Sun Pharma, BPCL, and GAIL, will trade ex-dividend this week. Key dates include February 2 for BPCL, February 3 for Cochin Shipyard, and February 4 for ITC, with various payouts for eligible shareholders.

items.title: A Budget that underscores credibility and invests for competitiveness
items.summary: With focus on fiscal prudence and improving ease of living citizens, the Budget announcements will help secure strategic materials through the Rare Earth Corridors, bringing in logistics reform of inland waterways,  and give a fillip to MSMEs

items.summary: Indian automobile manufacturer Tata Motors Passenger Vehicles Ltd. on Sunday said that its sales in the domestic and international market, including that of electric vehicles (EV), stood at 71,066 units in January 2026, marking a 47.1 per cent rise year-on-year.

items.title: Union Budget 2026: Duty free import of processing inputs to boost export of value added seafood
items.summary: India's seafood exports are set to see more value-added products. A threefold increase in duty-free import limits for processing inputs will lower production costs. This move aims to boost competitiveness against rivals like Vietnam and Thailand. Value-added products currently form a small portion of India's seafood exports. This change is expected to significantly improve that share.

items.summary: The government has allocated a ₹500 crore special package for former ULFA members' families as part of the Union Budget. This initiative, alongside other development funds for tribal and Adivasi groups in the Northeast, aims to accelerate development and employment opportunities in the region, aligning with the vision of 'sabka sath, sabka vikas'.

items.title: Travel industry welcomes measures aimed at boosting tourism, but long-standing demands remain
items.summary: The Union Budget has welcomed hospitality sector reforms like a National Institute and high-speed rail corridors, alongside a TCS reduction on overseas tour packages. However, a drastic cut in marketing and promotion spends for domestic and inbound tourism has raised concerns, potentially impacting foreign tourist arrivals despite infrastructure development.

items.summary: Sensex fell 1,547 points during Budget 2026 special session, yet select stocks defied weakness. Oil India, Bharat Electronics, Axis Bank and SBI hit fresh 52-week highs, signalling strong momentum and bullish breakouts.

items.title: Passenger vehicle sales begin New Year with a strong start
items.summary: Automakers reported strong passenger vehicle sales in January, with Tata Motors and Mahindra & Mahindra seeing significant growth. Hyundai Motor India achieved its highest-ever monthly sales, while Toyota Kirloskar Motor also experienced a positive start to the year. The two-wheeler segment also demonstrated robust demand.

items.title: HUA ministry gets Rs 85,522 crore in Union Budget; PM SVANidhi allocation up by 57%
items.summary: The Union Housing and Urban Affairs Ministry receives a substantial Rs 85,522.39 crore in the Union Budget. The PM SVANidhi scheme for street vendors sees a significant 57 percent increase, receiving Rs 900 crore. The Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (Urban) also gets a considerable allocation. Funds are earmarked for urban development projects and missions.

items.title: F&O satta is highly risky... how can the government stay quiet: Nirmala Sitharaman on STT hike
items.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman defended the sharp hike in securities transaction tax on futures and options, citing risks from excessive speculation in derivatives. The Budget 2026 move triggered a sell-off in brokerage and exchange stocks, with the government saying the increase aims to curb systemic risk and protect small retail investors.

items.title: Union Budget aims to accelerate grid scale energy storage; enables seamless green energy integration, says Pralhad Joshi
items.summary: The Union Budget is set to boost India's energy sector. It will accelerate grid-scale energy storage and integrate renewable energy sources. Customs duty exemptions on key manufacturing components will strengthen domestic production. A new scheme for Carbon Capture Utilization and Storage is also announced. These measures aim for a self-reliant and sustainable energy future for India.

items.title: Budget doubles allocation for nuclear research to ₹2,410 cr
items.summary: Budget gives ₹1,977.20 crore for capital expenditure for nuclear research projects, against ₹928.95 crore in 2025-26 (RE) - an increase of 113%

items.title: Reliance to gain as Trump signals resumption of India–Venezuela oil trade
items.summary: India may soon resume buying Venezuelan oil. US President Donald Trump has indicated a deal is in concept. This move could significantly benefit Reliance Industries and state-run refiners like Indian Oil. Venezuelan crude offers attractive pricing and refining margins. The development signals a potential shift in global energy trade flows.

items.title: Budget bloodbath: Market breadth hits 5-year low as STT hike triggers widespread rout
items.summary: Nearly 1% of stocks plunged over 10%, a level of carnage mirrored only in 2023.

items.summary: To encourage foreign travel, the Union Budget also proposed to reduce the tax collected at source rate on the sale of overseas tour programme packages to 2%.

items.title: 2026 Budget: Customs duty exemption on lithium batteries to aid EV infra creation, says SIAM
items.summary: India's Union Budget 2026-27 proposes customs duty exemptions on goods for lithium battery production. This move aims to build a strong electric vehicle ecosystem. The budget also extends concessional duty benefits for lithium-ion cells and parts for electric vehicles. Increased capital expenditure and support for e-buses will drive manufacturing and green mobility.

items.title: Power sector PSUs' investments to rise nearly 19 pc to Rs 1.01 lakh cr in FY27
items.summary: The government plans a significant boost for state-owned power companies. Investment is set to rise by nearly 19 percent to over Rs 1 lakh crore in 2026-27. Major players like NTPC and Power Grid Corp will see substantial increases. This move signals a strong focus on enhancing the nation's power infrastructure.

items.title: Upcoming IPOs: NFP Sampoorna Foods, Grover Jewells to open next week, 5 SME listings scheduled; check full list
items.summary: The week of February 2 is expected to see limited mainboard IPO activity, focusing instead on SMEs like Grover Jewells, NFP Sampoorna Foods, and Biopol Chemicals. Several SME listings are also anticipated across BSE and NSE platforms.

items.title: 90s software boom all over again! What Raamdeo Agrawal said after Budget 2026
items.summary: Raamdeo Agrawal praised Budget 2026 as transformative for India’s digital future, citing data centre tax holidays and capex push. Despite STT-led volatility, he said strong fiscal discipline, infrastructure spending and IT clarity sustain India’s long-term earnings and growth outlook.

items.title: Budget 2026 addresses key bottlenecks for gems and jewellery: Industry
items.summary: The gems and jewellery sector has welcomed the Union Budget. Industry leaders state the budget is positive and growth-focused. Key bottlenecks are addressed, providing fresh momentum. Reforms in customs and SEZ sales are expected to boost manufacturing and exports. Stability in customs duty and GST is appreciated. This budget supports sustainable growth and India's position as a global jewellery hub.

items.title: SHE Mart: Women centric economic participation
items.summary: New Budget initiative builds on Lakhpati Didi programme; aims to move rural woman entrepreneurs from self help groups to enterprise ownership to sale and promote their rural and agricultural products

items.title: Union Budget: Law Ministry's e-Courts project gets ₹1,200 crore
items.summary: According to the budget document, the project has received ₹1,200 crore as against ₹1,500 crore in the budget estimate

items.title: Sensex crashes 1,547 points as STT hike on derivatives triggers massive selloff
items.summary: The proposed STT increase from 0.02 per cent to 0.05 per cent on futures emerged as the primary catalyst for the rout

items.title: Guns, Gear and Care: Budget 2026-27 delivers India’s biggest-ever defence push
items.summary: Budget 2026: Veteran welfare has received a strong push. The Ex-Servicemen Contributory Health Scheme (ECHS) has been allotted Rs 12,100 crore, which is 45.49 per cent higher than last year. This money will be used for the medical treatment of ex-servicemen and their families.

items.title: Budget boost: Excise relief on biogas-blended CNG to aid gas retailers
items.summary: The Indian government's FY27 budget exempts excise duty on biogas blended with CNG, potentially improving margins for gas retailers. While the national average biogas blend is low, some regions may see higher impacts. The budget also allocated funds for Ujjwala connections but deferred a diesel duty increase.

items.title: Watch: 16th Finance Commission report tabled | Union Budget 2026
items.summary: The Centre’s decision to retain States’ share in the common pool of taxes at 41% for 2026–31 has sparked criticism from opposition leaders. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman tabled the Sixteenth Finance Commission report in the Lok Sabha on February 1, 2026, setting the framework for tax devolution between the Centre and States. Several States, including Karnataka and Kerala, had sought a higher 50% share, citing rising fiscal responsibilities.

items.title: Budget 2026–27 balanced and growth-focused with thrust on inclusivity and yuva-shakti: FICCI
items.summary: FICCI has praised the Union Budget for fiscal year 2026-27. The budget emphasizes growth, inclusivity, and empowering the youth. It supports manufacturing, MSMEs, agriculture, and services. Increased public capital expenditure will boost infrastructure and logistics. Interventions in healthcare, education, and tourism will drive employment. Reforms aim to deepen capital markets and attract global investment.

items.title: MEA gets Rs 22,118 cr in Union Budget for 2026-27
items.summary: Bhutan receives the largest development aid of Rs 2,288 crore in India's Union Budget for 2026-27. Nepal and Maldives/Mauritius follow with significant allocations. The Ministry of External Affairs' total budget sees an increase, with a notable reduction for Bangladesh and no allocation for Chabahar port.

items.title: Union Budget 2026: Allocations to Ministries in graphics

items.title: Agri Budget FY27: Schemes, allocations more practical as Sitharaman avoids populism
items.summary: The Minister has trimmed the fat by withholding funds from underperforming schemes, sending a clear message that last year's "major announcements" require actual implementation to earn continued investment

items.title: Visionary Budget with long-term growth focus: R Doraiswamy, LIC
items.summary: LIC CEO & MD R Doraiswamy described the Union Budget as a visionary roadmap for India's ambition to become a top three global economy. He highlighted the focus on strategic industries, MSMEs, and rural income growth, expecting market sentiment to improve as the broader development push is assessed.

items.title: STT hike in F&O: Shankar Sharma, Deepak Shenoy, other market mavens react. Here’s what they said
items.summary: STT hike in F&amp;O: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced a sharp hike in STT - by 150% on futures transactions and 50% on options transactions. The move has elicited mixed reactions from market participants, with several industry leaders taking to social media platform X to voice their views.

items.title: Budget 2026: STT hike to hit derivatives trading volumes
items.summary: Shares of BSE Ltd, Angel One and Groww plummeted 5-9% after the Budget speech on Sunday, while the Nifty 50 was down 2%, reflecting fears that the substantial STT hike would result in less derivatives trading.

items.title: Top 10 High-Growth stocks: Profit surges over 150% in Q3FY26
items.summary: Several Nifty 500 companies delivered exceptional Q3FY26 profit growth, with net profits rising over 150% year-on-year. Energy, real estate, finance, metals, and capital goods firms dominated the list, reflecting a low base effect, cyclical recovery, and improved operating leverage, according to StockEdge profitability scan data in the December quarter period.

items.title: Budget 2026: Finance Minister launches India Semiconductor Mission 2.0 with Rs 40,000 crore outlay
items.summary: Budget 2026: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Sunday announced the launch of India Semiconductor Mission (ISM) 2.0, with a Rs 40,000 crore outlay, aiming to boost the country's semiconductor ecosystem.

items.title: Union Budget: Law ministry's e-Courts project gets Rs 1,200 crore
items.summary: The Union Budget has allocated Rs 1,200 crore for the e-Courts project's third phase. This ambitious initiative aims to digitise all subordinate courts across India. The project, approved by the Union Cabinet, has a total financial outlay of Rs 7,210 crore. It will be implemented over four years, continuing the ICT enablement of the Indian Judiciary.

items.title: Union Budget strengthens India's long term economic trajectory: Ashok Leyland
items.summary: Union Budget 2026: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman presented a budget focused on growth and development. Increased spending on infrastructure, manufacturing, and defence will boost economic growth. This will drive demand in the commercial vehicle sector. The budget also supports key sectors like healthcare, education, and agriculture. It advances initiatives in AI and energy transition.

items.title: Kerala CM slams Union budget, accuses Centre of neglecting state
items.summary: CM also expressed disappointment over the finance commission allocation, noting that the rejection of the demand to increase Kerala's share, which remains at 41 per cent, undermines federal principles.

items.title: IT sector looks forward to improved ease of business with latest budget proposals
items.summary: Union Budget FY27 eases tax norms for IT and software exporters by expanding safe harbour limits, simplifying transfer pricing, improving buyback taxation, and offering long tax holidays to foreign cloud firms using Indian data centres, enhancing competitiveness and investment appeal.

items.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman proposed five new tourism destinations in the Purvodaya States, the launch of Buddhist Circuits across Arunachal Pradesh, Sikkim, Assam, Manipur, Mizoram, and Tripura, and provision of 4,000 e-buses

items.title: Budget 2026 proposes Rs 43,290 crores transfer to J&K in FY27, up 4.72 percent
items.summary: Jammu and Kashmir will receive over Rs 43,290 crore in central assistance for 2026-27. This represents a significant increase from the previous fiscal year. Funds are allocated for central assistance, the Jhelum-Tawi Flood Recovery Project, and disaster relief. Capital expenditure support remains consistent. This financial boost aims to support the Union Territory's development and recovery efforts.

items.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman presented the Union Budget, draped in a Kanjivaram saree. The speech focused on investments and growth. Prime Minister Narendra Modi called it historic and futuristic. Opposition members raised concerns about their states being ignored. The budget was prepared at Kartavya Bhavan. Members exchanged greetings and offered condolences.

items.title: Nirmala Sitharaman wants to control F&O ‘satta’ with STT hike but there could be unintended consequences
items.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman’s steep STT hike on futures and options has triggered sharp market backlash, with brokerages and exchanges tumbling up to 9%. Experts warn the move could drain liquidity, deter foreign investors and hurt India’s market competitiveness, even as the government defends it as a curb on excessive speculation.

items.title: Is Budget 2026 good enough to counter the impact of geopolitical risks, stalled India-US trade deal?
items.summary: The Budget prioritizes fiscal consolidation and long-term growth, focusing on infrastructure and competitiveness. Experts note its awareness of India-US trade dynamics while avoiding dependence on trade deals, aiming for structural inflows and resilience against external shocks.

items.title: Budget 2026 sets out targeted measures for States
items.summary: Eastern India, mineral-rich states and the Northeast emerge as major beneficiaries

items.title: Silver rate today: White metal crashes over  ₹1,50,000/kg in three sessions. Is it the right time to buy silver?
items.summary: Silver rate today: In a special session on Sunday, February 1, the white metal plunged over 9% lower circuit, with the March contract plunging  ₹26,273 to  ₹2,65,652 per kilogram.

items.summary: Budget removes earlier distortions in buyback taxation, easing compliance for investors while tightening promoter treatment

items.summary: Foreign investors are still unsettled by the Supreme Court’s Tiger Global tax ruling, and that backdrop mattered as Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman spoke about India’s fiscal position in Budget 2026.

items.title: Govt proposes 38 pc higher outlay for telecom to Rs 73,990 cr, BSNL gets Rs 28,473 crore
items.summary: The government plans a significant increase in the telecom ministry's budget. This boost is primarily for state-run BSNL's capital needs, including spectrum and network expansion. Funds will also support the BharatNet rural broadband project. The allocation shows a nearly 40 percent rise, aiming to strengthen BSNL's operations and reach. The North East region also sees increased funding for development projects.

items.title: Union Budget 2026: What gets cheaper, what gets costlier?
Union Budget 2026: Customs duty rationalisation to help boost exports, promote manufacturing, say experts
items.summary: Budget 2026-27's customs duty rationalization is set to boost exports and domestic manufacturing by lowering costs for key sectors like clean energy and healthcare. Experts highlight the removal of basic customs duty on capital goods and strategic inputs, alongside increased duty-free import limits for seafood processing, as significant steps towards enhancing competitiveness and self-reliance.

items.title: Closing Bell: Dalal Street in panic—why Budget 2026 sparked a bloodbath? Vijay Kedia explains
items.summary: Indian equity markets ended sharply lower after the presentation of the Union Budget 2026, as investors reacted to unmet expectations and the absence of strong market triggers, with benchmark indices witnessing heavy selling during the session. The BSE Sensex fell 1,546.84 points to 80,722.94, while Nifty 50 slipped 495.20 points to 24,825.45.

items.title: Budget 2026 reassures bond markets on fiscal discipline, borrowing size keeps yields in focus
items.summary: Budget 2026-27 signals fiscal discipline and policy continuity, reassuring bond markets. While structural reforms aim to deepen the bond market, a higher gross borrowing program is a key factor. Investors will watch the Reserve Bank of India for liquidity cues. The budget balances growth spending with macroeconomic stability, setting a path for long-term sustainability.

items.title: Union Budget: Gift City units get extended tax holiday
items.summary: India's GIFT City, a global financial hub, has received a significant fiscal boost with its tax holiday extended to 20 years. Entities will then be taxed at a lower 15% rate, enhancing offshore financial competitiveness. This move strengthens GIFT City's position as a globally competitive financial hub.

items.title: Stock Market Highlights: Sensex plunged 1546.84 pts or 1.88% to close at 80,722.94, and Nifty 50 dragged 495.20 pts or 1.96% to settle below 25,000 mark at 24,825.45; STT on futures contracts increased from 0.02% to 0.05% in Budget
items.summary: Sensex, Nifty, Share Price Highlights: Benchmark indices were trading in sharply negative territory after the Budget proposed taxing buyback for all types of shareholders as capital gains, and the securities transaction tax on futures was raised to 0.05% from present 0.02%. STT on options premium and exercise of options are both proposed to be raised to 0.15% from the present rate of 0.1% and 0.125%, respectively.

items.title: Explained: Why SBI, Canara Bank, other PSU bank stocks tumbled up to 9% after Union Budget 2026
items.summary: PSU bank stocks tumbled in the special Sunday session after the Budget’s record borrowing plan sparked fears of rising bond yields and mark-to-market losses. SBI, Bank of Baroda, Canara Bank, Indian Bank and Bank of India led the decline, dragging the Nifty PSU Bank index sharply lower as investors priced in treasury risks.

items.title: Union Budget 2026 Highlights: Key announcements & takeaways need to know
items.summary: Discover the key highlights and takeaways from the 2026 Union Budget, focusing on economic growth, infrastructure, and tax reforms

items.title: A Budget for health, capability, and global responsibility
items.summary: The Union Budget 2026 underscores a commitment to building strong institutions, nurturing human capital, and creating systems that serve both present and future generations

items.title: Budget 2026: FM Sitharaman confident rare-earth corridors will POWER Indian economy
Savings slowdown: The budget for 2026-27 does little to address a major financial problem
items.summary: India’s headline growth numbers look reassuring, but it has missed an opportunity to fix a pressing problem. With household savings slowing, banks are short of funds. A few fiscal remedies could have helped

items.title: Budget 2026: The 14 States mentioned by Finance Minister and a breakdown of related projects
items.summary: While 14 States received direct mentions, the Budget’s footprint expands to 24 States and territories through strategic projects in rail, heritage, and industrial corridors

items.title: Union Budget allocates Rs 6,000 crore for Census 2027
items.summary: The Union Budget has allocated Rs 6,000 crore for Census 2027, a significant increase from previous years. This decadal exercise, delayed due to Covid-19, will commence on April 1, 2027, with a reference date of March 1, 2027, for most of the country. The census will be fully digital and include caste enumeration.

items.title: Budget 2026: Government to focus on tier II, III cities, temple towns which need modern infrastructure, says Sitharaman
items.summary: The government will now concentrate on developing tier II and tier III cities, including temple towns. These areas will receive modern infrastructure and basic amenities. A budget of Rs 5000 crore per city economic region is proposed over five years. This initiative aims to boost economic growth by enhancing urban potential.

items.title: Budget 2026: Infrastructure push sets the stage for a real estate revival
items.summary: Union Budget 2026 reinforced India’s infrastructure led growth strategy with higher capital expenditure, de risking mechanisms and improved connectivity. Industry leaders expect these measures to boost execution, liquidity and long term demand across real estate segments, supporting urban expansion, housing activity and investment-led development over the medium to long term.

items.title: BSE, Angel One, Groww, Nuvama, IIFL shares fall as STT hike sparks volume worries
items.summary: The increased STT on futures contracts and on options premium could cool participation in the derivatives segment, according to analysts

items.title: Nifty 50, Sensex crash 2% on STT hike — Will this stock market correction be short lived? Explained
items.summary: The Indian stock market experienced a sharp decline due to increased Securities Transaction Tax on derivatives, with a 1,547-point drop in the BSE Sensex. Analysts expect the market to recover quickly, focusing on fundamentals and macro stability rather than the immediate transaction cost impact.

items.title: Budget 2026: No change in income tax slabs, new I-T Act takes effect from April 1
items.summary: The Union Budget 2026-27 maintained the status quo on direct tax rates

items.title: Budget 2026 boosts outbound tourism with lower TCS and skill initiatives
items.summary: New initiatives include creating a National Institute of Hospitality, upskilling 10,000 guides at iconic sites, and establishing a National Destination Digital Knowledge Grid.

items.title: Union Budget 2026 creates growth opportunities for northeast and industries
items.summary: The budget demonstrates to FINER that the government implements actual reforms instead of making empty promises while maintaining its schedule fiscal reduction strategy.

items.title: Budget 2026-27 targets rural diversification with fisheries, livestock initiatives
items.summary: Budget 2026-27 introduces a significant package for livestock, fisheries, and high-value agriculture. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced measures to boost rural incomes beyond traditional farming. These include zero duty on marine catch, support for inland fisheries, and increased veterinary professionals. High-value crops like coconut and sandalwood will also receive attention.

items.title: 10 Big Budget Takeaways: Major infra push, some good news for RIIs, mood dampener for day traders! Anil Singhvi explains
items.summary: Market veteran Anil Singhvi has highlighted 10 major takeaways from the Union Budget for FY27, which proposes an ambitious fiscal deficit roadmap, record capex and major hikes for derivative traders on Dalal Street.

items.title: Apple to benefit as Centre to allow foreign firms fund equipment for manufacturers
items.summary: In India, Apple was concerned that ​if it paid for machines for its contract manufacturers, Indian law ⁠could consider that a so-called “business connection” and impose taxes on its iPhone sales profits

items.title: ITC investors alert: What does a hike in statutory tobacco taxation in Budget fineprint reveal
items.summary: ITC shares fell nearly 3% during the Budget-day session as investors reacted to the December cigarette tax overhaul kicking in from February 1 and a statutory increase in NCCD rates for tobacco products. While the effective duty remains unchanged for now, the move has added policy uncertainty and pressured sentiment.

items.title: Capgemini to sell U.S. unit linked to ICE
items.summary: CapGemini said the ‌process of divestment would be "initiated immediately" but ‌did not say whether the sale was due to CGS' contract with ICE.

items.title: Budget touches upon govt's aim to create big home-grown accounting firms
items.summary: The Union Budget aims to bolster home-grown accounting and advisory firms by integrating Income Computation and Disclosure Standards into Indian Accounting Standards, eliminating separate ICDS requirements from tax year 2027-28. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman also proposed rationalizing the definition of accountant for Safe Harbour Rules to support this vision and attract foreign investment.

items.title: Union Budget boosts public broadcasting, media talent with Rs 4,551.94 crore outlay
items.summary: The Union Budget has allocated Rs 4551.94 crore to the Information and Broadcasting Ministry. A significant portion will support Prasar Bharati, India's public broadcaster. Funds are also earmarked for developing talent in animation, visual effects, and gaming. The community radio movement will receive support. This budget aims to boost media infrastructure and content creation across India.

items.title: STT hike unlikely to rattle long-term foreign investors, may curb speculative trading: Ashishkumar Chauhan
items.summary: The government's increased Securities Transaction Tax on derivatives aims to curb speculation and encourage long-term investing. While high-frequency traders may need to adjust strategies, foreign portfolio investors are expected to remain unaffected, prioritizing company growth and economic stability over short-term trading costs.

items.title: STT hike in F&O intended to discourage speculative trade, handle systemic risk in derivatives: Revenue Secretary
items.summary: The Budget has proposed an increase in the STT on futures contracts to 0.05% from 0.025%. STT on options premium and exercise of options are proposed to be raised to 0.15% from the present rate of 0.1% and 0.125%, respectively

items.title: Investors see red as Budget offers little to celebrate. What went wrong?
items.summary: The BSE Sensex closed 1.9% lower at 80,722.94, while Nifty 50 fell 2% to 24,825.45. Losses intensified in the broader markets, with Nifty Smallcap 250 declining 1.7% and Nifty Midcap 100 dropping 1.6%.

items.title: Budget 2026: Experts flag STT hike concerns, support long-term structural reforms
items.summary: Measures to attract foreign investment, including higher PMS limits for NRIs, drew positive response, while market innovations like total return swaps and a market-making framework boosted investor confidence

items.title: Gen Z budget: Sitharaman takes the boring out of budgeting
items.summary: Budget 2026-27 embraces younger Indians' priorities. It recognizes the creative economy, promoting careers in animation and gaming. Tourism shifts to experiences and sustainability. Cheaper global consumption acknowledges evolving consumer habits. AI integration is highlighted across sectors. Mental health receives national attention, reflecting a significant cultural and economic shift.

items.title: Sensex down over 1,500 points after Budget, but 27 stocks drawing attention
items.summary: Indian equities fell sharply after Union Budget 2026, with the Sensex dropping nearly 1,600 points. However, infrastructure focused announcements on capex, high speed rail, rare earths, data centres and medical tourism brought 27 stocks into focus as potential beneficiaries of the government’s investment push.

items.title: Budget 2026: Growth oriented budget, says Vedanta Group Chairman Anil Agarwal
items.summary: Industrialist Anil Agarwal praises the Union Budget. He notes its focus on growth and public capital expenditure. The budget aims to create jobs for youth and empower women. It also supports sectors like medical tourism. Special attention to critical minerals and rare earths is welcomed. This will boost growth and mineral security. The government is steering the economy steadily.

items.title: Budget FY27 gives boost to aircraft manufacturing, seaplane initiative
items.summary: Customs duty exemption for manufacturing, VGF scheme for sea plane operations

items.title: Tax holiday for GIFT City businesses doubled to 20 years
items.summary: It also proposed that the business income of units from IFSC after the expiry of period of deduction will be taxed at rate of 15 per cent

items.title: Sitharaman hints at hidden forces behind the rupee’s fall
items.summary: Global uncertainty is impacting the Indian rupee. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman stated domestic fundamentals remain strong. The Economic Survey notes a weaker rupee is currently helping exports. However, prolonged weakness could affect investor confidence. The rupee has seen volatility recently. The Reserve Bank of India intervenes to manage excessive fluctuations.

items.title: Highest-ever capex of Rs 12.22 lakh crore in FY27, 4.4% of GDP: Sitharaman
items.summary: India's capital expenditure is set for a record high. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced Rs 12.22 lakh crore for 2026-27. This significant investment represents 4.4 per cent of the nation's GDP. This figure marks a substantial increase from previous years. The government aims for a realistic and responsible fiscal deficit target of 4.3 per cent for FY27.

items.title: NCRTC allocation dips about 25% to over Rs 2,000 crore in Union Budget
items.summary: The Union Budget 2026-27 has allocated over Rs 2,000 crore to NCRTC for the RRTS project, a decrease from previous years. This funding aims to decongest the Delhi-NCR and reduce pollution via faster public transport. The project's Phase I includes three major corridors, with a 55-km section of the Delhi-Meerut corridor currently operational.

items.title: Cathie Wood says gold, not AI, is in a bubble — Here's why
items.summary: Cathie Wood argues the current bubble is in gold, not AI, citing historical trends and the US dollar's strength. She warns of potential gold price peaks, indicating signs of a trend reversal linked to gold's market capitalisation relative to the US money supply.

items.title: SEZs to boost domestic sales as Budget eases duty norms
items.summary: Industry awaits clarity on eligibility and caps; level-playing field to be ensured for units operating outside the SEZs in the domestic market

items.title: Budget 2026: STT hike to squeeze brokers' earnings
items.summary: Proposed STT hikes on equity futures and options are expected to cut derivatives volumes, hurt liquidity providers, and pressure broker revenues. Broking stocks fell sharply as higher trading costs threaten margins, especially for firms heavily reliant on equity derivatives income.

items.title: Union Budget 2026: Sitharaman ‘fully committed’ to privatisation drive, says all approved disinvestments to go through
items.summary: India Budget 2026: The government aims to raise ₹47,000 crore from disinvestment and asset monetisation in FY26, shifting focus from targets to improving company valuations and funding infrastructure. Privatisation remains a cabinet commitment, with efforts to enhance public sector company worth before market sales. IDBI Bank's significant stake sale is a key transaction in the pipeline.

items.title: Fiscal prudence a positive, markets spooked by STT and borrowings: Amitabh Chaudhry
items.summary: The Union Budget has drawn mixed market reactions. Amitabh Chaudhry sees stability and continuity as positives. Focus areas include pharmaceuticals, semiconductors, and infrastructure. While higher borrowings and transaction taxes are concerns, details may bring market calm. The budget aims for self-reliance and institutional scale.

items.title: Budget 2026: Allocation to AYUSH Ministry sees 20% rise
items.summary: The AYUSH ministry budget sees a significant 20 percent increase for the upcoming fiscal year. Three new All India Institutes of Ayurveda will be established to boost research. The government also plans to upgrade the WHO Global Traditional Medicine Centre in Jamnagar.

items.title: Rupee near 92: Why are analysts pricing in more currency slump after the Budget?
items.summary: The Economic Survey had earlier flagged risks from the external sector, including volatile capital flows and global financial tightening. Analysts say these concerns are now playing out more visibly in currency markets.

items.summary: Realtors' apex body CREDAI expressed disappointment with the Union Budget for lacking incentives to boost affordable housing, warning of a further decline in its share of new home launches. While welcoming the focus on infrastructure development and ease of doing business, CREDAI urged urgent policy attention to affordable housing to ensure inclusive urban growth.

items.summary: With its 2026 Union Budget, India places a spotlight on the future of healthcare, specifically targeting biologics and biosimilars. A visionary Biopharma Shakti initiative, infused with Rs 10,000 crore, is poised to fuel groundbreaking innovations. By enhancing clinical trial infrastructures and fortifying the CDSCO's role, drug development is set for a remarkable upgrade.

items.summary: The Ministry of Mines found significant reserves of rare earth elements in Andhra, and in 2024, some blocks were given to the State government for auction for exploration

items.title: UPI transactions soar to record at Rs 28.33 lakh crore in January
items.summary: Unified Payments Interface transactions hit a new high in January. Indians made 21.7 billion UPI payments. The total value of these transactions reached Rs 28.33 lakh crore. This shows a significant increase from the previous month. The growth in UPI usage continues to be strong. This digital payment system is rapidly expanding its reach across the nation.

items.title: Budget 2026 reflects clarity of thought, compassion, conviction: Andhra Health Minister Satya Kumar Yadav
items.summary: Andhra Pradesh Health Minister Satya Kumar Yadav said the Budget is the best possible under the present global political turbulence and economic challenges

items.summary: The Budget establishes particular methods that will increase farmers' incomes by improving their productivity and creating new income sources for small and marginal farmers. The government revealed its intention to construct 500 reservoirs together with Amrit Sarovars through its initial major funding program.

items.title: Budget 2026: Centre earmarks Rs 299 crore for training of babus, Rs 65 crore outlay for administrative reforms
items.summary: The Union Budget 2026-27 allocates Rs 299 crore for training government employees domestically and internationally. An additional Rs 65 crore is designated for administrative reforms, including e-governance and public grievance redressal. Mission Karmayogi, a major civil services capacity building initiative, receives Rs 126 crore.

items.title: Budget 2026: Here are the key numbers — From capex to fiscal deficit, revised estimates and more
items.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman in Budget 2026 projected a fiscal deficit of 4.3% of GDP for FY27. The government aims for a debt-to-GDP ratio of approximately 50±1% by 2030-31, reducing interest payments and allowing more funds for priority sectors.

items.title: Budget 2026: Delhi Police gets Rs 12,503 crore allocations
items.summary: Delhi Police receives a significant budget boost for 2026-27. The Union Budget allocates Rs 12,503.65 crore, a 4.79% rise. These funds will support daily operations and key initiatives. Projects include developing a model traffic system and enhancing communication networks across the NCR region. Upgrades to technology and personnel training are also prioritized.

items.title: Budget 2026: Not a big-bang budget, but a build-better one
items.summary: Budget 2026-27 prioritises durable growth through manufacturing, infrastructure and MSMEs, eschewing headline-grabbing tax giveaways for stability amidst global fragility. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman focuses on long-term economic foundations, including fiscal discipline and a new debt-to-GDP anchor, aiming for resilience over immediate applause.

items.title: Centre earmarks ₹299 cr for training of babus, ₹65 cr outlay for administrative reforms

items.title: Budget 2026 hands Apple a win by letting foreign firms fund equipment for manufacturers
items.summary: India has exempted foreign companies from taxes on machinery provided to contract manufacturers for five years, a significant win for Apple. This move aims to boost electronics manufacturing by removing tax risks associated with ownership of high-end equipment, fostering faster scale-up and greater confidence for global players.

items.title: Tourism gets strategic recognition in Union Budget: Brigade Hotel
items.summary: The Union Budget has recognized the tourism sector's potential. It aims to boost skilled human capital and infrastructure for tourism growth. The budget also focuses on strengthening healthcare capacity. This includes expanding allied health professional institutions. New professionals will be added over five years. Regional Medical Value Tourism hubs are proposed to promote India as a medical tourism destination.

items.title: Setback for Elon Musk as US judge signals xAI's trade theft allegations against OpenAI may get dismissed
items.summary: Elon Musk's xAI lawsuit against OpenAI may soon be dismissed as a federal judge tentatively supports OpenAI's request. xAI alleged unfair competition and trade secret theft, but the judge found their claims lacked plausibility. xAI may amend its claims if the case is dismissed.

items.title: Why did Wipro, TCS, Coforge and other tech stocks rally up to 4.6% despite stock market sell-off? Explained
items.summary: Wipro, TCS, and LTI Mindtree saw significant gains on February 1, defying a broader market sell-off after a tax holiday announcement for foreign cloud service providers. The Nifty IT index rose 2%, signaling a potential end to its two-day decline.

items.title: STT bombshell hits Dalal Street: Top 10 laggards in Sunday’s Budget special trading session
items.summary: Indian stocks slumped in Sunday’s special Budget session after the sharp STT hike on futures and options triggered heavy selling. MCX, Hindustan Copper, Hindustan Zinc, Angel One, BSE and other major names ranked among the top Nifty 500 losers

items.title: Biocon's Shaw says Budget boosts India’s health and innovation agenda
items.summary: The Union Budget is making a significant investment in India's health and innovation. Biopharma has been identified as a key strategic sector. A new initiative, 'Biopharma Shakti', will receive Rs 10,000 crore over five years. This funding will boost manufacturing, regulation, and clinical trials. The aim is to establish India as a global biopharma manufacturing hub.

items.title: Health Ministry gets 10% rise in allocation, 5 regional medical hubs; training allied healthcare professionals, caregivers in focus
items.summary: Strong care ecosystem, covering geriatric and allied care services, to be built

items.title: Budget 2026: Who gains or loses in India infrastructure push, derivatives tax?
items.summary: India's federal budget unveils a massive $133 billion investment for infrastructure and manufacturing. The plan aims to boost sectors from textiles to electronics. Taxes on equity futures are increased to curb speculation. The budget focuses on economic resilience amid global uncertainty. Key sectors like pharmaceuticals and electronics are set to benefit from new initiatives.

items.title: Defence allocation hiked by 15% to ₹7.84 lakh crore amid rising security concerns
items.summary: Defence Secretary RK Singh told businessline that the Ministry of Finance has agreed to the “unprecedented hike”  in the budget sought by the Ministry of Defence on the basis of “improved absorption and strategic challenges”

items.title: India Budget 2026: A proposal 'close' to Sitharaman's heart found place in this year's Budget
items.summary: Union Budget 2026: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman highlighted customs duty exemptions for life-saving medicines in the Union Budget 2026-27. Seventeen cancer drugs and medicines for seven rare diseases will be fully exempt from basic customs duty. This move aims to ease the financial burden on patients. The budget also introduces a trust-based customs system, AI deployment, and revised baggage rules.

items.title: Budget 2026 slashes customs duties on 17 cancer drugs, eases baggage rules
items.summary: The Union Budget 2026-27 introduces significant customs reforms. Exemptions are being rationalised, and customs duty on 17 cancer drugs is waived. Rules for personal baggage are eased, and the duty on goods for personal use is reduced to 10 percent. A trust-based customs regime with a single window system and AI integration is planned.

items.title: Budget 2026: CCUS push with Rs 20,000 crore outlay to help decarbonize hard-to-abate sectors
items.summary: India's Union Budget allocates Rs 20,000 crore for carbon capture technology. This initiative will boost decarbonization in key industries like power, steel, cement, and chemicals. The goal is to scale up this technology to reduce emissions. This move supports India's climate goals and export competitiveness. The program aims to balance energy security with environmental targets.

items.title: Budget 2026: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman proposes to set up 3 new All India Institutes of Ayurveda
items.summary: Budget 2026: In her ninth Union Budget, the Finance Minister announced major steps to strengthen the infrastructure of traditional medicine. She proposed setting up three new All India Institutes of Ayurveda across the country. Check details:

items.title: Budget 2026: Road transport allocation climbs to Rs 3.09 lakh crore for FY27
items.summary: Union budget of India: The government has announced a significant boost for road infrastructure. For the fiscal year 2026-27, the road transport and highways ministry will receive Rs 3.09 lakh crore. This represents an increase of approximately 8 percent from the previous year's allocation. The National Highways Authority of India, or NHAI, will also see its funding rise to Rs 1.87 lakh crore.

items.title: Budget 2026: Auto sector left wanting
items.summary: The hope from the Union Budget 2026-27 was for a clear policy nudge, if not a shove, towards EVs, hybrids, and the broader automobile ecosystem.

items.summary: A National Handloom and Handicraft programme has been proposed to integrate and strengthen existing schemes and ensure targeted support for weavers and artisans

items.summary: A tax holiday is a temporary government incentive that reduces or eliminates specific taxes—such as corporate income tax, property tax, or sales tax—for a defined period. Designed to stimulate economic activity, it encourages investment in new industries, supports startups, or boosts consumer spending by lowering tax burdens.

items.title: Budget 2026 PDF in Hindi and English: Direct links to download the FM Sitharaman's speech and highlights

Key announcements include extended deadlines for revising returns, staggered filing timelines, and targeted tax relief for individuals, NRIs, and small taxpayers. The budget also introduced lower TCS on foreign spending and higher STT on futures and options.

The National Fibre Mission and Textile Eco Initiative are designed to enhance production capabilities. These strategic efforts are poised to help the sector seize the advantages presented by recent free trade agreements. Additionally, extended export timelines and enhanced logistics will provide essential support to garment exporters.

The initiative aims to position India as a leading medical tourism destination.

items.title: Budget 2026: Over Rs 95,000 crore allocated for VB-G RAM G, MGNREGA gets Rs 30,000 crore
items.summary: The Centre has allocated Rs 95,692.31 crore for the new VB-G RAM G scheme, set to replace MGNREGA and promise 125 days of work annually. The overall Budget for the Department of Rural Development has seen a significant increase, aiming to foster self-reliant and developed villages across the nation.

items.title: Budget 2026: Gold, Silver prices movements post Budget
items.summary: Gold, silver remain under pressure; traders attribute decline to global macro factor, rather than Budget announcements

items.title: Union Budget 2026: Paytm shares surge 9%. Here’s what’s driving the rally
items.summary: Paytm shares jumped sharply after Budget 2026 announced a significantly higher incentive allocation for UPI and RuPay, boosting sentiment around digital payments. Strong volumes accompanied the rally as investors cheered policy support, while improved profitability and steady revenue growth further strengthened confidence in the fintech company’s outlook.

items.title: Rs 1,102 crore allocated in Budget for ministers' salaries, entertainment of state guests, ex-governors
items.summary: The Union Budget 2026-27 earmarks Rs 1,102 crore for key government offices. This includes substantial funds for the Council of Ministers, the Prime Minister's Office, and the Cabinet Secretariat. Hospitality and entertainment for state guests also receive an allocation. The National Security Council Secretariat and the Principal Scientific Advisor's office see budgetary provisions.

items.title: Infra gets a leg up in Budget 2026-27
items.summary: The government is launching an Infrastructure Risk Guarantee Fund to support lenders and boost private developer confidence. Capital expenditure for infrastructure creation will see an 11% increase. Focus will be on developing infrastructure in Tier II and Tier III cities. A new scheme will also promote domestic manufacturing of construction and infrastructure equipment.

items.title: Hindustan Copper, Bharat Dynamics, Hindustan Zinc, National Aluminium: Top 20 stocks that slumped the most post Budget
items.summary: The sharpest early losses were concentrated in a handful of pockets

items.title: Budget 2026: What indirect tax measures FM Sitharaman announced? Check full list
items.summary: Union Budget 2026–27 rationalises customs duties across key sectors to support domestic manufacturing, promote exports, ease personal imports and medicines, and simplify customs processes, FM Nirmala Sitharaman announces.

items.title: BSE revises price band mechanism for gold and silver ETFs amid record volatility
items.summary: The change comes as precious metals witnessed extreme volatility with gold futures plunging approximately 16%, while silver experienced a sharper correction of nearly 40%

items.title: Budget 2026: Roads and highways allocation rises to Rs 3.10 lakh crore
items.summary: The government is significantly boosting funds for roads and highways. The Ministry of Road Transport and Highways receives Rs 3.10 lakh crore for the upcoming fiscal year. This increased allocation will drive the development of national highways and expressways. Maintenance of existing road networks also receives a substantial focus.

items.title: Tourism received strategic recognition in union budget: Brigade Hotel
items.summary: The recent budget has given strategic recognition to the tourism sector. It also strengthens healthcare capacity with an investment-led focus. The budget emphasizes infrastructure development and experiential tourism. Skilled human capital development is a key focus for tourism. The healthcare sector will see the addition of one lakh professionals.

items.title: Union Budget 2026: Eleven mentions of AI in Nirmala Sitharaman’s address are the highest ever for an FM’s speech
items.summary: The Union Budget 2026 speech saw the term Artificial Intelligence (AI) mentioned a record eleven times by the Finance Minister

items.title: Gokaldas Exports posts Rs 15 crore Q3 profit, sees sequential recovery despite US tariff impact
items.summary: Gokaldas Exports posted ₹15 crore Q3 FY26 profit, up 81% sequentially, hinting recovery despite global headwinds. Yearly profit fell on US tariffs, while productivity gains, cost controls, stable revenue, and improving margins supported quarter-on-quarter performance across India and Africa outlook.

items.title: Custom duty exemption on capital goods needed for critical minerals, to set up dedicated corridors
items.summary: The finance minister proposed to reduce custom duty on Monazite under critical mineral section to zero from existing 2.5%

items.title: Budget 2026-27 focuses on skilling and upskilling across healthcare and tourism
items.summary: Union Budget, presented by finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Sunday, shows 62% increase in budgetary allocation to the ministry of skills development and entrepreneurship at Rs 9885.80 crore as against Rs 6100 crore allocated in 2025-26 to take up sector-specific skilling in a big way.

items.title: Budget FY27: FM unveils three-pronged ‘champion’ strategy to scale MSMEs
items.summary: Announces ₹10,000 crore SME growth fund, liquidity support through TReDS, professional support from `corporate mitras’

items.title: Budget 2026: Sitharaman backs private developers with new Infrastructure Risk Guarantee Fund
items.summary: Union Budget of India 2026: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has introduced a groundbreaking Infrastructure Risk Guarantee Fund designed to empower lenders through partial credit guarantees. Recognising the potential of Tier-II and Tier-III cities, the government is committed to fostering infrastructure development in these areas.

items.title: Hotter, drier February looms over India, putting winter crops at risk
items.summary: India faces a warmer and drier February after an unusually warm January. This weather pattern poses risks to key winter crops like wheat, rapeseed, and chickpeas. Higher temperatures could accelerate crop growth, leading to yield losses. This situation may increase India's reliance on imported cooking oils. Farmers have planted record areas of wheat and rapeseed.

items.title: Budget 2026: No allocation for Chabahar port project in Union Budget
items.summary: India has not allocated funds for the Chabahar port project in its Union Budget. This move comes as the US has imposed sanctions on Iran. India has been a major partner in developing the port. The US had granted a waiver on sanctions for Chabahar, which ends soon. India is discussing the project with the US.

items.title: Budget 2026 trims food, fertiliser and fuel subsidy outgo by 4.47% in FY27
items.summary: The government's annual subsidy expenditure on food, fertilizer, and fuel is projected to decrease by 4.47% to Rs 4,10,495 crore in FY27. This reduction is driven by lower estimates for food, fertilizer, and petroleum subsidies, with the Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Anna Yojana remaining a significant allocation for food support.

items.title: Union Budget rolls out roadmap to digitise heritage and open up archaeological sites
items.summary: Finance Minister announced National Destination Digital Knowledge Grid to document all places of significance

items.title: FM announces container manufacturing scheme with Rs 10,000 cr outlay
items.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced ambitious plans to boost India's logistics and infrastructure. A Rs 10,000 crore scheme will foster container manufacturing. New dedicated freight corridors and 20 National Waterways will be operationalized. Coastal shipping and inland waterways will see increased usage. Seaplane manufacturing will also be promoted to enhance connectivity and tourism.

items.title: Explained: What STT hike on derivatives means for futures and options traders?
items.summary: Union Budget 2026 raised securities transaction tax on futures and options, increasing trading costs across India’s derivatives market. The move triggered a sharp sell off in brokerage and exchange stocks and renewed concerns over liquidity, volumes and foreign investor participation in one of the world’s largest F&O markets.

items.title: Over ₹95,000 crore allocated for VB-G RAM G, MGNREGA gets ₹30,000 crore in Budget
items.summary: The MGNREGA scheme will continue till the VB-G RAM G is implemented, and the pending works are completed

items.title: Gold, silver continue to fall in India as market opens for Budget
items.summary: The yellow metal quotes ₹1.53 lakh per 10 gm in the spot market, and the white metal slips below ₹2.70 lakh a kg

items.title: FM Sitharaman proposes 'East Coast Industrial Corridor', 5 tourism destinations in 'Purvodaya' States in Union Budget
items.summary: Nirmala Sitharaman proposed to launch a scheme for the development of Buddhist circuits in six northeastern States

items.title: Not just F&O traders: FM Sitharaman has disappointing news for Sovereign Gold Bond investors too!
items.summary: The Union Budget 2026 introduced new taxation rules for Sovereign Gold Bonds, increasing the burden on investors not part of the original issue, alongside setbacks for F&amp;O traders in the stock market.

items.title: Dedicated rare earth corridors in TN, Kerala, would promote mining: CII
items.summary: The Union Budget 2026 proposal towards establishment of Rare Earth Corridors would help promote mining, processing, research and manufacturing and thus help build India's leadership in rare earth magnets

items.title: India's Budget 2026 'tactical', not 'breakthrough', Moody's Ratings says
items.summary: Moody's Ratings described India's annual federal budget as "tactical" but not a "breakthrough," stating planned fiscal consolidation will not alter the country's credit profile. While the budget aims to boost manufacturing and growth amid global volatility, tax reforms and large borrowings are expected to weigh on revenue and potentially crowd out private investment.

items.title: Budget 2026: What may become cheaper and costlier in FY27? Full list inside
items.summary: Union Budget 2026: Overall, the focus on infrastructure, semiconductors, bio-pharma, and strategic manufacturing is a positive factor for the overall investment story of India and broadens the investment universe beyond a specific set of sectors.

items.title: Budget 2026: India hikes Bangladesh grants by 74% in FY27, scraps Chabahar port funding amid US pressure
items.summary: For FY27, the Government of India has ₹60 crore in grants to Bangladesh, up from ₹34.48 crore in the revised estimates for FY26

items.title: Finance Minister announces 5 university townships near major industrial logistic hubs in Union Budget
items.summary: Nirmala Sitharaman also announced the setting up of one girls' hostel in every district of the country

items.title: Hindustan Zinc, NALCO to Hind Copper: Metal stocks crash up to 19% on MCX gold, silver price rout on Budget Day
items.summary: Metal stocks faced significant selling pressure on January 30, following sharp declines in gold and silver prices. Companies like Hindustan Zinc and Vedanta reported steep losses, while the Nifty Metal index fell over 5%.&nbsp;

items.title: Union Budget 2026-27: Finance Minister Sitharaman proposes incentives of ₹100 crore for single bond issuance by municipal corporations
items.summary: The Finance Minister also announced restructuring of REC Limited and PFC as part of the government's public sector financial institution strengthening

items.title: Union Budget’s urbanization measures to help reshape real estate growth
items.summary: The Union Budget 2026-27 is set to redefine real estate demand by fostering urbanisation and expanding economic reach beyond major metros. New City Economic Regions and high-speed rail corridors will drive growth in tier-2 and tier-3 cities, supported by infrastructure development and public sector land recycling through REITs.

items.title: Union Budget 2026: Securities Transaction Taxes for derivatives on futures and options trade increased
items.summary: The Budget also proposed changes in taxation of buybacks, which involves companies repurchasing their own shares from existing shareholders usually from the open market or through a tender offer

items.title: Biocon Biologics sees Biopharma SHAKTI as major boost for India’s biosimilar ambitions
items.summary: India's biopharmaceutical sector receives a significant boost with the Union Budget's ₹10,000 crore Biopharma SHAKTI programme. This initiative aims to enhance domestic manufacturing and innovation capabilities. Industry leaders believe it will help India build globally competitive biologics and biosimilar strengths. The programme focuses on innovation, global scale, and regulatory improvements.

items.title: Budget 2026: REITs gain up to 3% as FM proposes recycling significant real estate assets of CPSEs
items.summary: Real Estate Investment Trusts (REITs) like Brookfield India Real Estate Trust, Nexus Select Trust, Embassy Office Parks REIT gained up to 3% after Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced the creation of dedicated Real Estate Investment Trusts (REITs) for Central Public Sector Enterprises (CPSEs).

items.title: Emphasis on biologics, biosimilars  is  timely: Dr Reddy’s Chairman Satish Reddy
items.summary: The addition of new NIPERs and the upgrading of existing ones will expand opportunities for advanced scientific education and skills development, building the talent pipeline essential for innovation-led growth, he added

items.title: Budget 2026: Odisha, T.N., Andhra, Kerala to get dedicated rare earth corridors to promote research and mining
items.summary: The move comes as India looks to reduce its dependence on China for rare-earth minerals. Two of the four states, Tamil Nadu and Kerala, are set to go to Assembly elections in 2026

items.title: Budget 2026: Govt to upgrade allied health institutions, train 1 lakh professionals
items.summary: The government plans to boost healthcare by upgrading allied health institutions and training one lakh professionals over five years.  Caregiver training will also expand.  Five regional hubs will be established to promote medical tourism.  New Ayurveda institutes and upgrades to AYUSH facilities are also planned to meet global demand.

items.title: STT increase in Budget 2026: What is STT in stock market and how it affects traders, FPIs?
items.summary: STT increase in Budget 2026: In her Budget speech, Sitharaman proposed to increase STT by a massive 150% on futures transactions and by 50% on options transactions. The announcement shook Dalal Street, and Sensex crashed more than 2,000 points, while Nifty 50 slipped below 24,600 level intraday.

items.title: Budget 2026: Crypto taxation unchanged, industry disappointed over missed reforms
items.summary: The Union Budget 2026 kept crypto taxation unchanged, retaining the 1% TDS and loss set-off restrictions, disappointing the industry, which says the measures continue to deter investors and traders.

items.title: Budget 2026: Why HAL, BEL and other defence stocks are falling even after 18% capex hike
items.summary: Defence stocks fell on Budget day despite a sizeable increase in capital outlay, as the hike came in below market expectations and broader sentiment weakened. HAL, BEL, BDL, Mazagon Dock and Paras Defence saw sharp declines, with higher STT and a risk-off shift adding to the post-Budget pressure on the sector.

items.title: Union Budget: Five regional medical hubs to be set up to boost medical tourism in country
items.summary: Finance Minister Sitharaman also announced setting up of three new All India Institutes of Ayurveda to strengthen research in the field

items.title: Budget 2026: One-time measure proposed to facilitate sales from SEZs to domestic market at concessional duty
items.summary: Ms. Sitharaman said that necessary regulatory changes will be undertaken to operationalise these measures while ensuring level-playing field for the units working in the DTA

items.title: Budget lacks bold reforms, focuses on cautious continuity: Swaminathan Aiyar
items.summary: Economist Swaminathan Aiyar finds the Union Budget unremarkable. He notes a lack of bold reforms and simplification, with many small changes increasing complexity. Fiscal consolidation is marginal. The budget prioritizes stability amid strong growth. Major reforms like fertiliser subsidy abolition were avoided. Sector-specific measures are politically understandable but economically modest.

items.title: Govt plans to monetise real estate assets of CPSEs via dedicated REITs
items.summary: The government on Sunday proposed to accelerate "recycling" of real estate assets owned by Central Public Sector Enterprises (CPSEs) through the setting up of dedicated real estate investment trusts (REITs).

items.title: Budget 2026: Realty stocks plunge up to 10% on Budget miss; REITs rally up to 3%
items.summary: Realty stocks fell sharply after Budget 2026 disappointed the sector with no major incentives, dragging the Nifty Realty index lower. Developers saw heavy losses amid unmet housing expectations, while REITs outperformed, supported by the government’s continued focus on urban infrastructure development and asset monetisation through dedicated REIT structures.

items.title: Budget jitters spark sell-off on Dalal Street: Sensex crashes over 2400 pts, Nifty down 1%
items.summary: Max Health, Wipro, Sun Pharma, TCS and Dr Reddy’s Lab traded as major gainers, while Hindalco, Bharat Electronics, Shriram Finance, Coal India and SBI depreciated the most among Nifty 50 pack

items.title: Budget 2026: Government to provide tax holiday for foreign companies offering cloud services using India data centres
items.summary: To avail the tax holiday, companies need to provide services to Indian customers through an Indian reseller entity

items.title: Budget 2026: E2E Networks, Anant Raj shares jump up to 14% as FM proposes tax holiday for data centre investments
items.summary: Anant Raj shares rose 14% to  ₹576, while E2E Networks gained 10% to  ₹2,334 after the Union Budget announced tax incentives for data centers. The government aims to enhance digital infrastructure and AI capabilities in India with long-term tax benefits for cloud service providers.

items.title: Union Budget 2026-27: Totally lacklustre, says Congress
items.summary: "The speech was also non-transparent since it gave no idea whatsoever of budgetary allocations for key programmes and schemes," Jairam Ramesh said

items.title: Nifty knocked down after STT increase, breaks the 200-DMA support
items.summary: The benchmark index has however recovered from the intraday low, but need to see if that sustains

items.title: Budget 2026: India’s pharma leap, BioPharma SHAKTI gets ₹10K cr; 1,000 clinical trial sites planned
Bharat Dynamics, Data Patterns to BEL: Why defence stocks fell after Budget 2026 announcements?
items.summary: Defence stocks fell on February 1 after no specific policy announcements in Budget 2026, despite a 15% budget increase to  ₹7.85 lakh crore for the sector, focusing on military preparedness and personnel welfare.

items.title: Union Budget 2026-27: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announces ₹20,000-crore carbon capture, utilisation scheme
items.summary: The Union Finance Minister said the government will provide incentives for manufacturing seaplanes in the country as part of efforts to boost tourism

items.title: Budget 2026: ₹10,000 crore SME fund set up to revive MSMEs
items.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced a ₹10,000 crore SME Growth Fund in the Union Budget to improve credit access, modernise industrial clusters, and strengthen small businesses hit by financial stress

items.title: Union Budget 2026-27: Government proposes launch of Khelo India mission to transform sports sector
items.summary: On January 31, 2018, Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the Khelo India school Games at Delhi. It was rebranded as Khelo India Youth Games form 2019 onwards

items.title: Union Budget 2026: FM Sitharaman launches India’s Semiconductor Mission 2.0
items.summary: The new mission will focus on industry-led research and training centres to develop technology and a skilled workforce

items.title: Union Budget 2026: Duty cuts for batteries, solar, biogas; east coast corridor, NE tourism gets boost
items.summary: Union Budget 2026: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman unveiled the India Budget. Key proposals focus on clean energy, industrial growth, and regional development. Incentives are planned for lithium-ion cell manufacturing and solar glass production. Biogas-blended CNG will see excise duty relief. An East Coast Industrial Corridor is proposed. Investments will boost the Northeast with e-buses and tourism development.

items.title: Cargo clearance approvals to be seamlessly processed through single window by year-end: FM
items.summary: India Budget 2026: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced that a single window for cargo clearances will be operational by year-end, streamlining approvals. The validity period for advance customs binding will be extended to five years, and duty exemptions will be provided for fish catch by Indian vessels. Baggage clearance rules for international travelers are also being revised.

items.title: Union Budget 2026: India set to host first ever Global Big Cat summit
items.summary: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the International Big Cat Alliance (IBCA) was set up last year

items.title: Trump claims India will buy Venezuelan oil instead of Iranian crude
items.summary: India had been a major buyer of Iranian oil until 2019, when imports were significantly reduced following the reimposition of US sanctions on Tehran

items.title: Rs 10 lakh crore wiped out! Sensex sheds over 1,500 points, Nifty below 25,000; Why did the stock market crash after Budget?
items.summary: Indian stocks fell sharply in Sunday’s special trading session after the Union Budget 2026 raised STT on futures and options. The steep hike in derivatives taxes triggered a broad sell-off, as investors worried about lower trading volumes and earnings pressure for exchanges and retail brokerages.

items.title: Union Budget 2026: FM plans FEMA overhaul, introduces total return swaps for corporate bonds
items.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced a review of FEMA rules to modernize foreign investment frameworks and proposed introducing total return swaps on corporate bonds in the Union Budget 2026.

items.title: Union Budget 2026: Government to tax buybacks as capital gains, says FM Nirmala Sitharaman
items.summary: The Finance Minister said to incentivize misuse of tax arbitrage, the promoters will pay an additional buyback tax

items.title: Markets slip into red as budget optimism fades, Nifty down over 2%
items.summary: Market breadth remained negative with 2,294 stocks declining against 1,602 advancing on the BSE, while 200 remained unchanged out of 4,096 stocks traded

items.title: Budget 2026: Finance Minister proposes 5 medical tourism hubs
items.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced plans for five regional medical tourism hubs. A Rs 10,000 crore Biopharma Shakti program will boost domestic production of biologics and biosimilars over five years. This initiative includes new NIPERs and upgrading existing ones. The plan also aims to establish 1,000 accredited clinical trial sites and strengthen drug regulation.

items.title: Budget 2026: FM Nirmala Sitharaman announces 6-month foreign asset disclosure scheme for small taxpayers
items.summary: FM Nirmala Sitharaman said there will be no interest liability on taxpayers on the penalty amount for the period of appeal before first appellate authority, irrespective of outcome

items.title: UPI transactions hit record high of ₹28.33 lakh crore in January
items.summary: On a month-on-month basis, the growth was 21% in value terms
